snippet: The explosion in the militant hub of North Waziristan also wounded at least 25 soldiers and followed a week of other attacks that left more than 130 people dead.
abstract: Roadside bomb in militant hub of North Waziristan kills at least 14 Pakistani soldiers and wounds at least 25 soldiers; toll follows week of other attacks that left more than 130 people dead; provincial government is trying address political fallout.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Declan Walsh from Karachi, Pakistan. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The explosion in the militant hub of North Waziristan also wounded at least 25 soldiers and followed a week of other attacks that left more than 130 people dead.

headline.seo: Bomb Kills 14 Pakistani Soldiers in Tribal Area
headline.main: Bomb Kills 14 Pakistani Soldiers as Attacks Shake Up Provincial Government
headline.print_headline: Bomb Kills 14 Pakistani Soldiers as Attacks Shake Up Provincial Government
